intro: Uragoga calothyrsa, commonly known as the Hawaiian red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its vibrant red or pink flowers, which bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green, often with a reddish tinge along the veins. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Uragoga calothyrsa is an important part of the local ecosystem and is also cultivated for its ornamental value.
